title: update failed
body:
don't know what's going on with the new patch 5.8 update, what I got is:
step 1/2: updating interface | 2.44 MB 32%
and it left me with a message says:
update failed
unspecified error occurred. Please check the logs for more information
===================================================================================================================
000000.000|       0.0000kb|      0.0000kb added| ALWAYS| Logging started at 2015-04-30T07:40:12.273

000000.004|       0.0000kb|      0.0000kb added|   OKAY| Riot::RADS::Common::ReleaseManifest::LoadFromFileHandle: Succeeded
000000.004|       0.0000kb|      0.0000kb added|   OKAY| Riot::RADS::FileSystem::Impl::RuntimeEnvironment::GenerateFileMap: start building file map

000000.004|       0.0000kb|      0.0000kb added| ALWAYS| Riot::Client::RunUx: Running LoLPatcherUx version 0.13.0.1001
000000.083|       0.0000kb|      0.0000kb added|   OKAY| Browser 1 created.
000000.223|       0.0000kb|      0.0000kb added|   OKAY| Registering V8 context for browser 1, frame 1, url file:///bundle-chrome/src/index.html.
000000.536|       0.0000kb|      0.0000kb added|   OKAY| Registering V8 context for browser 1, frame 3, url file:///bundle-client-hub/www/index.html.

000000.798|       0.0000kb|      0.0000kb added|   OKAY| Registering V8 context for browser 1, frame 5, url file:///bundle-hub-news-C/public/index-news1.html.

The above is what I copy from the log in patcher logs
Please help me :(

replies.body: Happening at the exact same spot as me (2.44mb) since the new patch was released.  Tried repairing and restarting..  can somebody please address this? OP are you still having the same problem?

> [{quoted}](name=HORSE OF FORCE,realm=OCE,application-id=ElA0rvVL,discussion-id=PaEYApyy,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2015-05-01T09:18:57.659+0000)
>
> The magic number.
> 
> I presume you're on Windows and are using the default installation location. Go to "C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_air_client\releases\" and then find the latest version number (the highest and last modified). Go in it. Create a new, empty file in the latest version folder named "S_OK", with no extension. Restart League with admin privileges.
> 
> If you're interested, all this does is say to the patcher, "Alright, all the files you've downloaded thus far are a-OK. Continue downloading the rest!" The old patcher used to do this automatically on all machines, but for some reason, the new patcher is not doing this for the new machines, so it goes into conflict with itself and refuses to download the rest of the files. On that note, make sure to only do this after you've already attempted to patch once before, otherwise you'll be telling the client you have files that you don't actually have. Who knows what sorts of problems that could cause?
> 
> 
> If you need any further help, just ask. Best of luck.

I also got update failed.  and now it scans about 2000 files then says update failed
HALP RITO

> [{quoted}](name=HORSE OF FORCE,realm=OCE,application-id=ElA0rvVL,discussion-id=PaEYApyy,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2015-05-01T09:18:57.659+0000)

Go to "C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_air_client\releases\" and then find the latest version number (the highest and last modified). Go in it. Create a new, empty file in the latest version folder named "S_OK", with no extension. Restart League with admin privileges.
> 
> If you're interested, all this does is say to the patcher, "Alright, all the files you've downloaded thus far are a-OK. Continue downloading the rest!" The old patcher used to do this automatically on all machines, but for some reason, the new patcher is not doing this for the new machines, so it goes into conflict with itself and refuses to download the rest of the files. On that note, make sure to only do this after you've already attempted to patch once before, otherwise you'll be telling the client you have files that you don't actually have. Who knows what sorts of problems that could cause?
>

> If you need any further help, just ask. Best of luck.

>32%

The magic number.

I presume you're on Windows and are using the default installation location. Go to "C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_air_client\releases\" and then find the latest version number (the highest and last modified). Go in it. Create a new, empty file in the latest version folder named "S_OK", with no extension. Restart League with admin privileges.

If you're interested, all this does is say to the patcher, "Alright, all the files you've downloaded thus far are a-OK. Continue downloading the rest!" The old patcher used to do this automatically on all machines, but for some reason, the new patcher is not doing this for the new machines, so it goes into conflict with itself and refuses to download the rest of the files. On that note, make sure to only do this after you've already attempted to patch once before, otherwise you'll be telling the client you have files that you don't actually have. Who knows what sorts of problems that could cause?

For future reference, you shouldn't include logs in your post. They clog up the discussion, and cause chaos in more public areas. We have a perfectly functional attachment system for logs.

If you need any further help, just ask. Best of luck.
bro try restart comp thats what i did working fine now
